alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 6:18PM CDT until March 31 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Jo Daviess County in northwestern Illinois... Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... Stephenson County in northwestern Illinois... Eastern Jackson County in east central Iowa... Northeastern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 618 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from New Diggings to Bulgers Hollow, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Argo Fay, Ideal and Wacker around 625 PM CDT. Warren, Fairhaven, Chadwick, Apple River, Jo Daviess County Fairgrounds and Apple River Canyon State Park around 630 PM CDT. Lanark, Milledgeville and Carroll County Fairgrounds around 635 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Winslow and Hitt. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and northeastern and east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and northeastern and east central Iowa.
